projects.title: AI Speech Emotion Recognition System
projects.subtitle: UVM · Advanced Machine Learning
bullets: 10–20ms real-time inference

modal.title: AI Speech Emotion Recognition System
modal.subtitle: UVM · Advanced Machine Learning
modal.body: Built a CRNN architecture (CNN + BiLSTM + Attention) for multilingual speech emotion recognition across eight datasets. Designed the training pipeline, evaluation, and interpretability tools, then deployed real-time inference with Flask.
bullets: 81.29% accuracy / 83.63% F1 (4-class) and 76.76% accuracy / 82.80% F1 (6-class)
Distance-weighted loss using arousal–valence theory and multilingual training
PyTorch, Python, Flask, Grad-CAM, attention maps

projects.title: Robot Vacuum & Plumbing Automation
projects.subtitle: Personal Project · Home Automation
projects.summary: Low-cost Dreame X30 Ultra automation for water plumbing and central-vacuum dust handling, with Python control being rewritten in C for efficiency.
bullets: Automates gray-water handling with periodic clean-water flushing
Uses base-pressure sensing signal to trigger pump control
Designed for lower cost and better long-term reliability than common kits
tileAlts: Robot vacuum plumbing automation prototype with labeled ports

modal.title: Robot Vacuum & Plumbing Automation
modal.subtitle: Personal Project · Home Automation
modal.body: In Progress automation for my family’s X30 Ultra focused on both plumbing and central-vacuum dust handling, using a Raspberry Pi, custom programming, 3D printed TPU parts, and online-sourced pumps. In parallel, I am developing central-vacuum integration for the base dustbin using 3D printed interfaces, automated gates, and a custom Dreame-compatible dustbin design. The goal is to replace failure-prone cheap pump kits with a system that better handles gray water and automatically performs periodic clean-water flushing to maintain pump health. The current system works, and I am actively rewriting parts of the working Python control code into C for better efficiency while continuing safety and reliability iteration. The system also automatically refills clean water for both the robot and base. Because the X30 Ultra base automatically doses detergent, the mopping workflow is largely hands-off aside from refilling detergent every few months and occasional baseboard cleaning.
bullets: Integrates pressure-sensing hardware from China to detect dock dump requests
Automatically turns on pumping when the robot base requests a water dump
Current system works while ongoing iterations focus on reliability and safety
Includes teardown-driven research on Dreame X30 base behavior and validation testing
Covers TPU print prototyping, plumbing research, Chinese translation/navigation for sourcing, and custom part selection
Actively developing central-vacuum dust handling via 3D printed parts, automated gates, and a custom Dreame-compatible dustbin
sliderAlts: Robot vacuum plumbing automation prototype with labeled ports
Plumbing automation prototype enclosure and tubing setup
3D printed TPU fitting on robot vacuum plumbing port
Pump and control box used in the plumbing automation system

projects.title: C++ Canvas Raster Graphics Editor
projects.subtitle: UVM · Advanced Programming
projects.summary: Real-time raster editor with layered buffers.
bullets: 7 tools + diff-based undo/redo
Lazy CPU→GPU texture updates

modal.title: C++ Canvas Raster Graphics Editor
modal.subtitle: UVM · Advanced Programming
modal.body: Built a real-time raster graphics engine with seven tools, multi-layer RGBA buffers, and diff-based undo/redo. Implemented OpenGL rendering with lazy texture updates and software blending, plus image filters via Python C API + NumPy.
bullets: 60 FPS at 800×600 with lazy CPU→GPU texture updates
Custom rasterization and per-pixel alpha compositing
C++, OpenGL, ImGui, Python C API, NumPy

modal.title: E-Ink iCloud Calendar Display
modal.subtitle: IoT · Product build
modal.body: Developed an IoT E-Ink display calendar integrating iCloud and public holiday APIs. Built a modular, object-oriented software architecture and custom layout engine with competitive materials cost.
bullets: Merged ICS and JSON events into a single display pipeline
Custom layout engine for readable, minimal displays
Python, CalDAV, Pillow, FreeCAD, E-Ink hardware

modal.title: Cleaning Robot (Stairs and Vertical Surfaces)
modal.subtitle: Personal Project · Robotics
modal.body: In Progress robotic cleaning platform that uses AI for navigation and movement. The current design uses a robotic arm with a vacuum nozzle to clean stairs and vertical surfaces such as cabinets, walls, and heat registers.
bullets: AI-assisted motion and path planning
Arm-mounted vacuum nozzle for targeted cleaning
Stair climbing is being tested and iterated with strong safety constraints

projects.title: Evolutionary Robotics Cumulative Project
projects.subtitle: UVM · CS3060 Evolutionary Robotics
projects.summary: Cumulative project using PyBullet, evolutionary methods, and neural-network robotics experiments in CS3060.
bullets: Designed and tested robot controllers in simulation
Applied evolutionary algorithms to improve behavior over iterations
Integrated weekly assignments into a single end-to-end project system
tileAlts: Evolutionary robotics cumulative project placeholder image

modal.title: Evolutionary Robotics Cumulative Project
modal.subtitle: UVM · CS3060 Evolutionary Robotics
modal.body: Cumulative course project developed in CS3060 under Joshua Bongard, a highly respected researcher in evolutionary robotics. The project used PyBullet to build a simulation-based evolutionary robotics workflow and combined weekly deliverables into a full experiment system involving neural-network and robotics components. As summarized by the course: Over the final four weeks of the semester, each student used their software system to perform an evolutionary robotics experiment, submitted weekly deliverables, handed in a written report, and gave an oral presentation during the exam period.
bullets: Implemented an iterative software pipeline for evolutionary robotics experiments
Used simulation outputs to compare robot designs and controller performance
Delivered a final integrated project with experiment results and presentation artifacts
Development progress video shows PyBullet-based experimentation
sliderAlts: Evolutionary robotics cumulative project placeholder image
